17#include <config.h>
18
19#include <stdbool.h>

21#include <isc/base64.h>
22#include <isc/buffer.h>
23#include <isc/lex.h>
24#include <isc/string.h>
25#include <isc/util.h>
26
27#define RETERR(x) do { \
28 isc_result_t _r = (x); \
29 if (_r != ISC_R_SUCCESS) \
30 return (_r); \
31 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
32
33
34/*@{*/
35/*!
36 * These static functions are also present in lib/dns/rdata.c. I'm not
37 * sure where they should go. -- bwelling
38 */
39static isc_result_t
40str_totext(const char *source, isc_buffer_t *target);
41
42static isc_result_t
43mem_tobuffer(isc_buffer_t *target, void *base, unsigned int length);
44
45static const char base64[] =
46 "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/=";
47/*@}*/
48
49isc_result_t
50isc_base64_totext(isc_region_t *source, int wordlength,
51 const char *wordbreak, isc_buffer_t *target)
52{
53 char buf[5];
54 unsigned int loops = 0;
55
56 if (wordlength < 4)
57 wordlength = 4;
58
59 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(buf));
60 while (source->length > 2) {
61 buf[0] = base64[(source->base[0]>>2)&0x3f];
62 buf[1] = base64[((source->base[0]<<4)&0x30)|
63 ((source->base[1]>>4)&0x0f)];
64 buf[2] = base64[((source->base[1]<<2)&0x3c)|
65 ((source->base[2]>>6)&0x03)];
66 buf[3] = base64[source->base[2]&0x3f];
67 RETERR(str_totext(buf, target));
68 isc_region_consume(source, 3);
69
70 loops++;
71 if (source->length != 0 &&
72 (int)((loops + 1) * 4) >= wordlength)
73 {
74 loops = 0;
75 RETERR(str_totext(wordbreak, target));
76 }
77 }
78 if (source->length == 2) {
79 buf[0] = base64[(source->base[0]>>2)&0x3f];
80 buf[1] = base64[((source->base[0]<<4)&0x30)|
81 ((source->base[1]>>4)&0x0f)];
82 buf[2] = base64[((source->base[1]<<2)&0x3c)];
83 buf[3] = '=';
84 RETERR(str_totext(buf, target));
85 isc_region_consume(source, 2);
86 } else if (source->length == 1) {
87 buf[0] = base64[(source->base[0]>>2)&0x3f];
88 buf[1] = base64[((source->base[0]<<4)&0x30)];
89 buf[2] = buf[3] = '=';
90 RETERR(str_totext(buf, target));
91 isc_region_consume(source, 1);
92 }
93 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
94}
95
96/*%
97 * State of a base64 decoding process in progress.
98 */
99typedef struct {
100 int length; /*%< Desired length of binary data or -1 */
101 isc_buffer_t *target; /*%< Buffer for resulting binary data */
102 int digits; /*%< Number of buffered base64 digits */
103 bool seen_end; /*%< True if "=" end marker seen */
104 int val[4];
105} base64_decode_ctx_t;
106
107static inline void
108base64_decode_init(base64_decode_ctx_t *ctx, int length, isc_buffer_t *target)
109{
110 ctx->digits = 0;
111 ctx->seen_end = false;
112 ctx->length = length;
113 ctx->target = target;
114}
115
116static inline isc_result_t
117base64_decode_char(base64_decode_ctx_t *ctx, int c) {
118 const char *s;
119
120 if (ctx->seen_end)
121 return (ISC_R_BADBASE64);
122 if ((s = strchr(base64, c)) == NULL)
123 return (ISC_R_BADBASE64);
124 ctx->val[ctx->digits++] = (int)(s - base64);
125 if (ctx->digits == 4) {
126 int n;
127 unsigned char buf[3];
128 if (ctx->val[0] == 64 || ctx->val[1] == 64)
129 return (ISC_R_BADBASE64);
130 if (ctx->val[2] == 64 && ctx->val[3] != 64)
131 return (ISC_R_BADBASE64);
132 /*
133 * Check that bits that should be zero are.
134 */
135 if (ctx->val[2] == 64 && (ctx->val[1] & 0xf) != 0)
136 return (ISC_R_BADBASE64);
137 /*
138 * We don't need to test for ctx->val[2] != 64 as
139 * the bottom two bits of 64 are zero.
140 */
141 if (ctx->val[3] == 64 && (ctx->val[2] & 0x3) != 0)
142 return (ISC_R_BADBASE64);
143 n = (ctx->val[2] == 64) ? 1 :
144 (ctx->val[3] == 64) ? 2 : 3;
145 if (n != 3) {
146 ctx->seen_end = true;
147 if (ctx->val[2] == 64)
148 ctx->val[2] = 0;
149 if (ctx->val[3] == 64)
150 ctx->val[3] = 0;
151 }
152 buf[0] = (ctx->val[0]<<2)|(ctx->val[1]>>4);
153 buf[1] = (ctx->val[1]<<4)|(ctx->val[2]>>2);
154 buf[2] = (ctx->val[2]<<6)|(ctx->val[3]);
155 RETERR(mem_tobuffer(ctx->target, buf, n));
156 if (ctx->length >= 0) {
157 if (n > ctx->length)
158 return (ISC_R_BADBASE64);
159 else
160 ctx->length -= n;
161 }
162 ctx->digits = 0;
163 }
164 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
165}
166
167static inline isc_result_t
168base64_decode_finish(base64_decode_ctx_t *ctx) {
169 if (ctx->length > 0)
170 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTEDEND);
171 if (ctx->digits != 0)
172 return (ISC_R_BADBASE64);
173 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
174}
175
176isc_result_t
177isc_base64_tobuffer(isc_lex_t *lexer, isc_buffer_t *target, int length) {
178 unsigned int before, after;
179 base64_decode_ctx_t ctx;
180 isc_textregion_t *tr;
181 isc_token_t token;
182 bool eol;
183
184 REQUIRE(length >= -2);
185
186 base64_decode_init(&ctx, length, target);
187
188 before = isc_buffer_usedlength(target);
189 while (!ctx.seen_end && (ctx.length != 0)) {
190 unsigned int i;
191
192 if (length > 0) {
193 eol = false;
194 } else {
195 eol = true;
196 }
197 RETERR(isc_lex_getmastertoken(lexer, &token,
198 isc_tokentype_string, eol));
199 if (token.type != isc_tokentype_string) {
200 break;
201 }
202 tr = &token.value.as_textregion;
203 for (i = 0; i < tr->length; i++) {
204 RETERR(base64_decode_char(&ctx, tr->base[i]));
205 }
206 }
207 after = isc_buffer_usedlength(target);
208 if (ctx.length < 0 && !ctx.seen_end) {
209 isc_lex_ungettoken(lexer, &token);
210 }
211 RETERR(base64_decode_finish(&ctx));
212 if (length == -2 && before == after) {
213 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTEDEND);
214 }
215 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
216}
217
218isc_result_t
219isc_base64_decodestring(const char *cstr, isc_buffer_t *target) {
220 base64_decode_ctx_t ctx;
221
222 base64_decode_init(&ctx, -1, target);
223 for (;;) {
224 int c = *cstr++;
225 if (c == '\0')
226 break;
227 if (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\n' || c== '\r')
228 continue;
229 RETERR(base64_decode_char(&ctx, c));
230 }
231 RETERR(base64_decode_finish(&ctx));
232 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
233}
234
235static isc_result_t
236str_totext(const char *source, isc_buffer_t *target) {
237 unsigned int l;
238 isc_region_t region;
239
240 isc_buffer_availableregion(target, &region);
241 l = strlen(source);
242
243 if (l > region.length)
244 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
245
246 memmove(region.base, source, l);
247 isc_buffer_add(target, l);
248 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
249}
250
251static isc_result_t
252mem_tobuffer(isc_buffer_t *target, void *base, unsigned int length) {
253 isc_region_t tr;
254
255 isc_buffer_availableregion(target, &tr);
256 if (length > tr.length)
257 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE);
258 memmove(tr.base, base, length);
259 isc_buffer_add(target, length);
260 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
261}
